wiki.content: "Wonderful Tonight" is written by Eric Clapton. It was included on Clapton's 1977 album Slowhand and released as a single the following year. In 1988, Clapton appeared in the Nelson Mandela 70th Birthday Tribute concert as a guest guitarist for Dire Straits. The group became his backing musicians for a surprise performance of "Wonderful Tonight" during their set. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mINPdUFVjSE User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Wonderful Tonight" is written by Eric Clapton. It was included on Clapton's 1977 album Slowhand and released as a single the following year. In 1988, Clapton appeared in the Nelson Mandela 70th Birthday Tribute concert as a guest guitarist for Dire Straits. The group became his backing musicians for a surprise performance of "Wonderful Tonight" during their set. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mINPdUFVjSE

track.name: Wonderful Tonight
comments: I'm pretty sure this is not actually Eric Clapton playing. I've never heard him use an electronic drum track like this, and the guitar sounds like it's going through the very first Crate amp I ever wailed on, which I think had a chorus button on it. Hahrrible.
Not the same version as on my E.C. Was Here...
often forget the great guitar player also writes great songs - oh the song is actually about being upset waiting for patti to get ready - sorry
Beautiful song! This is the kind of song I want so badly to write. Way to beat me to it Clapton : D
If there was only one musician to listen to for my entire life it would be E C .
Das waren die schönsten Zeiten meines Lebens.
I like this song, but this version kind of sucks. Those drums are terrible
One of the best songs. Ever!!
You've listened to Eric Clapton 366 times before and Wonderful Tonight 239 times before. !!!

just had to make a cover, such a lovely song 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lRPnltMGY9o
Love this song and all that Eric does
